org.berthold.life

Class Dish

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.berthold.life.Dish

  • public class Dish
extends java.lang.Object
    All methods needed to create and evaluate a dish of cells.
    Author:
    Berthold Fritz

    • Method Detail

      • setCell

        public boolean setCell(int x,
                       int y)
        Set a cell. Life cell has a integer value of 1.
        Returns:
        true if cell is inside dish, false if not.

      • killCell

        public boolean killCell(int x,
                        int y)
        Delete a cell. Death cell have a integer value of 0.
        Returns:
        true if cell is inside dish, false if not.

      • countLifeCellsSouroundingCellAt

        public int countLifeCellsSouroundingCellAt(int x,
                                           int y)
        Count life cells surounding a cell at the given coordinates.
        Returns:
        Number of cells alive. <0 if the given coordinates are outside of this dish.

      • compareToSecondDish

        public int compareToSecondDish(Dish secondDish)
        Compare this dish to another one.
        Both dishes must have equal dimensions. If not, both dishes are decleared as equal.

        ToDo: Check if both dishes hav equal dimensions.

        Returns:
        Number of cells which are not equal.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears this dish.

      • getCellAt

        public int getCellAt(int x,
                     int y)
        Get value of a cell at a given coordinate.
        Returns:
        1 for a life cell, 0 for a death cell. <0 if coordinates not equal to dimensions of dish.

      • generateRandomContents

        public void generateRandomContents(int density)
        Generate random dish.
